meanings.sent1: I mismark the answer on my test and got it wrong.
meanings.sent2: Please be careful not to mismark the boxes with the wrong labels.
meanings.sent3: During the game, I accidentally mismark the score and caused confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to mismark the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The artist's shaky hand would often mismark the canvas with unintended strokes.

meanings.definition: A mark that is incorrect or inaccurate.
meanings.sent1: The mismark on the map led us in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent2: He noticed a mismark on the document that needed correction.
meanings.sent3: The mismark on the ruler made the measurements all wrong.
meanings.sent4: The old building bore the mismark of time with its faded paint.
meanings.sent5: The mismark on the wall indicated where the painting should hang.
